metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19528 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.3.7, there is a use-after-free bug that can becaused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/usb/misc/iowarrior.cdriver, aka CID-edc4746f253d.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1058-aws - 4.4.0-1058.62
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1064-azure - 4.15.0-1064.69~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1058.62').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69~14.04.1').
